issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

I don't see in Base filter a rule which blocks `is1-ssl.mzstatic.com`.
There was a rule in AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, but it has been removed the same day when it was added - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/3892bd6f66a0a11f2f14b7cd662324c8ce435a11
Please try to update filters.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

Нажать на аватарку пользователя > > Ожидаемый результат: > Открылся попап профиля пользователя Яндекс ID > > Фактический результат: > Попап профиля пользователя постоянно загружается. > > > --------------------------------------------------------------------- > > > Steps: > 1. Click on the link https://ya.ru > 2. Click on the "Log in" button and log in to your Yandex account. > 3. There is an authorized user menu button in the upper right corner > 4. Click on the user's avatar > > Expected result: > A pop-up of the Yandex ID user profile has opened > > The actual result: > The user profile's popup is constantly being loaded. issue.title: Missing syntax or error on some filters

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuardHome

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://adguardteam.github.io/HostlistsRegistry/assets/filter_12.txt

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Hey,
Simply the syntax on your list here for example:
https://adguardteam.github.io/HostlistsRegistry/assets/filter_12.txt

For those lines starting with column like this:
://ww4.$denyallow=ww4.ikea.com
://ww5.$denyallow=ww5.ikea.com|ww5.msu.ac.zw
://popupblockergold.
://adblock-pro-download.
://142.91.159.
://23.109.150.

And lines starting with dash like this:
-outletcanada.
-norgesalg.com^

Is not documented here https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome/wiki/Hosts-Blocklists or here https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/ and cannot be found here https://adblockplus.org/filter-cheatsheet too 

If they are mistaken removes them, if they're some kind of comment use ! as you mention, otherwise if valid add the syntax to the wiki and kb 

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Less risk of blocking more than you need. The performance of regular expressions is also lower. Of course, this applies to more complex regular expressions.

issue.title: Many Hijacked Subdomains
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

_N.B.: Reposting https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/issues/572 from 3ya (!) for increased visibility._

According to another in a long-term series of articles, various subdomains of a number of Microsoft-owned domains have been hijacked.

[_Seizing subdomains. How I took over Microsoft subdomains and how to perform such attacks_](https://hackmag.com/security/subdomain-interception/) → https://github.com/EdOverflow/can-i-take-over-xyz has quite a lot of details re:  & especially combatting this.  _Some_ of the problem involves CNAME hacking.

 Hard lists of such seem difficult to find, but https://www.google.com/search?q=hijacked%20microsoft%20domains seems to give more pieces to the puzzle. _(Perhaps whenever DNSSEC is widely deployed this'll no longer be an issue.)_

### Proposed solution

🤷🏾‍♂️  I'm hoping you experts can come up w/ a good solution.

### Additional information

Thanks to @DandelionSprout for reminding me to followup on this.

comment.body: It describes a domain hijacking scenario. How should a DNS server prevent this from happening?

Реклама блокируется корректно. Судя по скриншоту, у вас используется почему-то обычный сертификат, иными словами сайт открывается без фильтрации, поэтому видна реклама.

issue.title: Many Hijacked Subdomains
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

_N.B.: Reposting https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/issues/572 from 3ya (!) for increased visibility._

According to another in a long-term series of articles, various subdomains of a number of Microsoft-owned domains have been hijacked.

[_Seizing subdomains. How I took over Microsoft subdomains and how to perform such attacks_](https://hackmag.com/security/subdomain-interception/) → https://github.com/EdOverflow/can-i-take-over-xyz has quite a lot of details re:  & especially combatting this.  _Some_ of the problem involves CNAME hacking.

 Hard lists of such seem difficult to find, but https://www.google.com/search?q=hijacked%20microsoft%20domains seems to give more pieces to the puzzle. _(Perhaps whenever DNSSEC is widely deployed this'll no longer be an issue.)_

### Proposed solution

🤷🏾‍♂️  I'm hoping you experts can come up w/ a good solution.

### Additional information

Thanks to @DandelionSprout for reminding me to followup on this.

comment.body: Prevent, no.  Detect & block such domains from access, maybe?

comment.body: Done in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/d8d55abc1c2026b172e4fae2ea1cc90cf219c495

Or maybe better add exception (with `xmlhttprequest` modifier) only for platforms which do not support `redirect` and `redirect` rule without `important`. In theory there might be cases where website checks content of the request and we will need to add exception with `important` modifier or exclude it from the rule with `important` modifier.
The same way as it's done for `www3.doubleclick.net` bait.

@zloyden According to - https://publicwww.com/websites/%22static.ads-twitter.com%2Fuwt.js%22/, `static.ads-twitter.com/uwt.js` is used on many websites, so I think that it would be better to add `xmlhttprequest` modifier to this rule, otherwise scripts will be unblocked.

After the filet updating, it's not reproduced on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body: @Alex-302 photos of people accounts in google meet After checking Network request, image requests to domain `https://lh3.googleusercontent.com` are failing and time out here is a photo of failing request when DNS is enabled, and success request when DNS is disabled. ![SCR-20240209-nzuu](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/26116580/1bfa96ce-2430-46bc-afdf-3aca9dcaeba7) STR: 1. Create adguard dns account 2. create new device (Router) 3. link device Using DNS (add server dns to primary and secondary DNS in router configuration) 4. choose AdGuard DNS filter as your only blocklist in adGuard dns server settings 5. After succesfully linking your device (Router) to adGuardDns Server (you can check this page "https://adguard.com/en/test.html" and make sure AdGuardDNS is Running) 6. go to google meet and join a meeting, you should find you account photo not appearing

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: Many Hijacked Subdomains
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

_N.B.: Reposting https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/issues/572 from 3ya (!) for increased visibility._

According to another in a long-term series of articles, various subdomains of a number of Microsoft-owned domains have been hijacked.

[_Seizing subdomains. How I took over Microsoft subdomains and how to perform such attacks_](https://hackmag.com/security/subdomain-interception/) → https://github.com/EdOverflow/can-i-take-over-xyz has quite a lot of details re:  & especially combatting this.  _Some_ of the problem involves CNAME hacking.

 Hard lists of such seem difficult to find, but https://www.google.com/search?q=hijacked%20microsoft%20domains seems to give more pieces to the puzzle. _(Perhaps whenever DNSSEC is widely deployed this'll no longer be an issue.)_

### Proposed solution

🤷🏾‍♂️  I'm hoping you experts can come up w/ a good solution.

### Additional information

Thanks to @DandelionSprout for reminding me to followup on this.

comment.body:
In any case, it's the wrong repository.
Better write here https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardDNS/issues

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.
